bioghist.p: W. Stanley Rycroft (1899-1993) was born in England in 1899. He graduated from Liverpool University in 1922, then went to Lima, Peru, as a missionary of the Free Church of Scotland, serving as a teacher in the Colegio Anglo Peruano and as vice principal from 1926 to 1940. He also taught English in the University of San Marcos in Lima and in 1938 earned the degree of Doctor of Philosophy from that University. In 1940 he returned to the United States and became Secretary of the Committee on Cooperation in Latin America, an interdenominational committee of thirty Protestant mission boards. From 1950 to 1966 he served on the staff of the Presbyterian Board of Foreign Missions and its successor, the Commission on Ecumenical Mission and Relations, until his retirement. He was the author of several books, including Religion and Faith in Latin America, On this Foundation and The Ecumenical Witness of the United Presbyterian Church in the USA. He was also a prolific writer for numerous publications. In his retirement, he was active in Common Cause and held various positions of leadership at the local level.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of W. Stanley Rycroft. Materials include typescripts of Rycroft's articles, addresses, book reviews, book chapters, and other writings; printed copies of articles and book reviews and other printed material by Rycroft; subject files on politics, culture, and the Church in Latin America; issues of Rycroft's Latin American Newsletter, 1940-1956; correspondence from his time teaching in Peru; correspondence related to his written works; photographs from various visits to Cuba, Guatemala, Costa Rica, Peru, and Brazil; and several scrapbooks of clippings and photographs, including a humorous 1979 compilation of black-and-white photographs and text documenting various national staff conferences from 1956 and 1958.
